Detailed Description

FlsFile provides an easy to use interface for using the FFS. Please also refer to the class FfsHandler, which provides an object-oriented interface for achieving information-related data from the FFS. FlsFile itself is also built upon the interface of FfsHandler.

After creation the file doesn't need to be opened explicitly, and the FlsFile::Write() method can be called right afterwards, even several times consecutively. After data is written once, it is also possible to call the FlsFile::Read() method without closing and reopening the file, since the necessary open-modes are managed internally. However, the call of FlsFile::Close() has to be done after all operations are finished, so other processes can gain access to this file, too.

Since only the FlsFile::Open() and FlsFile::Create() methods take either an id or a filename as parameter, either of these methods has to be called before other methods can be called.

If, for instance, the deletion of a file which has neither been opened nor created is necessary, please use the class FfsHandler and the regarding methods.

The methods which extract the file type from the filename use the methods of class MimeTypeTable.

The following code fragments show some examples of the FlsFile interface. If working on host, you can easily observe the content of the file with a simple text editor.

This piece of code creates a file and writes something into it: 

	FlsFile file;
	const CHAR *fname = "A";
	UINT32 filesize = 0;
	const CHAR src[] = "This text is written into the file."; 

	// Create a text file, 10 bytes large.
	if (file.Create(fname, FfsFileTypeTxt, 10)) { 
		// Check the filesize, must be 10.
		file.GetFileSize(filesize); 

		// Write some text into the file. Notice that the filesize gets increased automatically.
		file.Write(src, 0, sizeof(src)); 

		// Check the filesize, must be sizeof(src).
		file.GetFileSize(filesize); 

		// Close the file again for other processes can gain access.
		file.Close();
	} else { 
		// Something went wrong, check what.
		FfsError result = file.GetLastError(); 
		// Deal with the error.
		// ...
	}

This piece of code opens a file and modifies some data: 

	FlsFile file;
	const CHAR *fname = "A";
	INT offset = 0;
	const CHAR mod_src[] = "This text overwrites some data in the file."; 

	// Open the file with the given filename.
	if (file.Open(fname)) { 
		// Modify some part of the file.
		file.Write(mod_src, offset, sizeof(mod_src)); 

		// Close the file again for other processes can gain access.
		file.Close();
	} else { 
		// Something went wrong, check what.
		FfsError result = file.GetLastError(); 
		// Deal with the error.
		// ...
	}

This piece of code appends some data to the file: 

	FlsFile file;
	const CHAR *fname = "A";
	UINT32 filesize = 0;
	const CHAR app_src[] = "This text is appended to the file."; 

	// Open the file with the given filename.
	if (file.Open(fname)) { 
		// Append some data to the file using its filesize as offset.
		file.GetFileSize(filesize);
		file.Write(app_src, filesize, sizeof(app_src)); 

		// Close the file again for other processes can gain access.
		file.Close();
	} else { 
		// Something went wrong, check what.
		FfsError result = file.GetLastError(); 
		// Deal with the error.
		// ...
	}

This piece of code opens a file and reads data from it: 

	CHAR *dst = 0;
	FlsFile file;
	const CHAR *fname = "A";
	UINT32 filesize = 0;
	INT offset = 0; 

	// Open the file with the given filename.
	if (file.Open(fname)) {
		file.GetFileSize(filesize); 

		// Allocate memory to copy the file content into.
		dst = new CHAR[filesize]; 

		// Copy the whole data from the file into the buffer.
		file.Read(dst, offset, filesize); 

		// Close the file again for other processes can gain access.
		file.Close();
	} else { 
		// Something went wrong, check what.
		FfsError result = file.GetLastError(); 
		// Deal with the error.
		// ...
	}

FlsFile::FlsFile (   ) 
 

Default constructor. The user ID is set to FfsUserTypeMmi.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN FlsFile::AssureInitialized (  const CHAR *  filename  ) 
 

Assures that after the method call the file will be initialized

BOOLEAN FlsFile::Close (   ) 
 

Closes the file and makes it available for other processes. Only possible if the file exists and was opened or created before.

BOOLEAN FlsFile::Copy (  const CHAR *  dest_filename  ) 
 

Copies the source file to the specified dest_filename. If the dest_filename is in a directory, then this directory must already exist.

BOOLEAN FlsFile::Create (  const CHAR *  filename,
FfsFileType  file_type,
UINT32  size
) 
 

Creates a file with the specified filename, file_type, and size. This method is supposed to be used if you want to store a file of a known file_type, but without the respective extension.

BOOLEAN FlsFile::Create (  const CHAR *  filename,
UINT32  size
) 
 

Creates a file with the specified filename and size. Only possible if the file does not yet exist and the filename contains the extension, since the file type is gathered by parsing the extension of the filename.

BOOLEAN FlsFile::Create (  FfsFileId  id,
FfsFileType  file_type,
UINT32  size
) 
 

Creates a file with the specified id, file_type, and size. Only possible if the file does not yet exist.

BOOLEAN FlsFile::CreateStreaming (  const CHAR *  filename  ) 
 

Creates a file with the specified filename, file_type, and size. This method is supposed to be used if you want to store a file of a known file_type, but without the respective extension. The file is opened for streaming automatically.

BOOLEAN FlsFile::Delete (   ) 
 

Deletes the file. Only possible if the file exists and is not open anymore.

BOOLEAN FlsFile::GetDrmAttrib (  FfsDrmAttrib &  attrib  )  const
 

Gets the digital rights management attribute via attrib. This method only succeeds if the file handle is initialized.

See also:
IsInitialized()

BOOLEAN FlsFile::GetFileSize (  UINT32 &  file_size  )  const
 

Copies the actual size into file_size. Only possible if the file exists and was opened before.

BOOLEAN FlsFile::GetFileType (  FfsFileType &  file_type  )  const
 

Copies the actual type into file_type. Only possible if the file exists and was opened before.

BOOLEAN FlsFile::GetHandle (  FfsHandle &  file_handle  )  const
 

Retrieves the file handle. The file handle can only be retrieved if the file is open.

FfsError FlsFile::GetLastError (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the last occurred error. This method should be called after any method called before didn't return TRUE to determine the reason.

BOOLEAN FlsFile::GetTimestamp (  FfsTimeRecord &  time_stamp  )  const
 

Copies the actual timestamp into time_stamp. The timestamp contains the year, month, date, hour, and minute of either the creation or the last modification. Only possible if the file exists and was opened before.

FfsUserType FlsFile::GetUserId (   )  const [inline]
 

To determine the user id.

BOOLEAN FlsFile::IsInitialized (   )  const [inline]
 

Tells if the file has a name or an ID. The file gets assigned a name or an ID when it is opened or created.

BOOLEAN FlsFile::IsOpen (  void   )  const [inline]
 

Tells if the file is open.

BOOLEAN FlsFile::Open (  const CHAR *  filename,
FfsFileType  file_type
) 
 

Opens a file with the specified filename and file_type. Opening is only possible if the file exists.

BOOLEAN FlsFile::Open (  const CHAR *  filename  ) 
 

Opens a file with the specified filename. Opening is only possible if the file exists and the filename contains the extension, since the file type is gathered by parsing the extension of the filename.

BOOLEAN FlsFile::Open (  FfsFileId  id,
FfsFileType  file_type
) 
 

Opens a file with the specified id and file_type. Opening is only possible if the file exists.

BOOLEAN FlsFile::OpenStreaming (  const CHAR *  filename  ) 
 

Opens a file with the specified filename and file_type for streaming. Opening is only possible if the file exists.

BOOLEAN FlsFile::Read (  void FFS_HUGE *  dst,
UINT32  offset,
UINT32  max_no_bytes,
UINT32 &  bytes_read
)  const
 

Reads up to max_no_bytes bytes from this file starting at offset and copies them to the provided buffer dst. If the read operation was successful then argument bytes_read is set to the actual number of bytes read. This number may differ from max_no_bytes due to reaching the end of file while reading. Therefore it is essential to check bytes_read if TRUE is returned! Take care that if you start reading at the end of the file, i.e. parameter offset is greater than or equal to the size of the file, this method sets bytes_read to 0 and returns TRUE, signaling end of file!

Returns:
Flag indicating success. Please call GetLastError() to get an error code.

BOOLEAN FlsFile::Read (  void FFS_HUGE *  dst,
UINT32  offset,
UINT32  no_bytes
)  const
 

Copies the data from the file into the specified dst. Only possible if the file exists and was opened before.

BOOLEAN FlsFile::ReadStreaming (  void HUGE *  buffer,
UINT32  count,
UINT32  bytes_read
) 
 

Reads up to count bytes from this file starting at the current offset and copies them to the provided buffer buffer. If the read operation was successful then argument bytes_read is set to the actual number of bytes read. This number may differ from count due to reaching the end of file while reading. Therefore it is essential to check bytes_read if TRUE is returned! Take care that if you start reading at the end of the file, i.e. parameter offset is greater than or equal to the size of the file, this method sets bytes_read to 0 and returns TRUE, signaling end of file! The difference of the "Read" and the synchronous "ReadStreaming" is, that "ReadStreaming" runs with an higher priority and therefore may work faster.

Returns:
Flag indicating success. Please call GetLastError() to get an error code.

BOOLEAN FlsFile::ReadStreamingAsync (  void HUGE *  buffer,
UINT32  count,
void(callback_func)(File::Error result, UINT32 bytes_operated) 
) 
 

Reads up to count bytes from this file starting at the current offset and copies them to the provided buffer buffer. This function returns immediately after his call and signalises by calling the callback_func, when the asynchronous operation is finished. The result of the operation can be retrieved by the parameters of the callback_func

Returns:
Flag indicating success. Please call GetLastError() to get an error code.

BOOLEAN FlsFile::Rename (  const CHAR *  new_filename  ) 
 

Renames the file into new_filename. Only possible if the file exists and is not open anymore.

BOOLEAN FlsFile::Rename (  FfsFileId  new_id  ) 
 

Renames the file into new_id. Only possible if the file exists and is not open anymore.

BOOLEAN FlsFile::Resize (  UINT32  new_size  ) 
 

Resizes the file to the specified new_size. Data beyond the new_size will be deleted. Since the filesize is increased automatically from the Write() methods, this method should only be called if the file should getting smaller. Only possible if the file exists and was opened before.

BOOLEAN FlsFile::SetDrmAttrib (  const FfsDrmAttrib &  attrib  ) 
 

Sets the digital rights management attribute to attrib. This method only succeeds if the file handle is initialized.

See also:
IsInitialized()

BOOLEAN FlsFile::SetUserId (  FfsUserType  user_id  ) 
 

To set/change the user id. Only possible if the file is closed. Be aware: The last error is not updated, in case of failing, just FALSE is returned!

void FlsFile::StreamingDriverReadCallback (  FfsError  result,
void *  client_arg
)  [static]
 

void FlsFile::StreamingDriverWriteCallback (  FfsError  result,
void *  client_arg
)  [static]
 

BOOLEAN FlsFile::Write (  const void FFS_HUGE *  src,
UINT32  offset,
UINT32  no_bytes
) 
 

Copies the data from the specified src into the file. Only possible if the file exists and was opened before. If offset and no_bytes exceeds the actual filesize, the filesize will automatically increased.

BOOLEAN FlsFile::WriteStreaming (  const void HUGE *  buffer,
UINT32  count
) 
 

Copies the data from the specified src into the file. Only possible if the file exists and was opened before. If offset and no_bytes exceeds the actual filesize, the filesize will automatically increased. The difference of the "Write" and the synchronous "WriteStreaming" is, that "WriteStreaming" runs with an higher priority and therefore may work faster.

BOOLEAN FlsFile::WriteStreamingAsync (  const void HUGE *  buffer,
UINT32  count,
void(callback_func)(File::Error result, UINT32 bytes_operated) 
) 
 

Copies the data from the specified src into the file. Only possible if the file exists and was opened before. If offset and no_bytes exceeds the actual filesize, the filesize will automatically increased. This asynchronous method returns immediately after his call and signalises the end of the write operation by calling the callback_func.
